review_blob: On cask @ The Bruery. Cloudy orange beer without much/any head to speak of. If you dig the horchata (Or Xata) beers and variants, then this is another solid entry. The coffee and chocolate work nicely with the vanilla and spice character from the base beer. Certainly still pretty sweet, though. Good coffee aroma here, some cinnamon, and a nice creamy cocoa quality. Mouthfeel could be better, but I dig it.
beer_name: The Bruery Presenting His Royal Majesty, King Dr. Exita V

review_blob: On tap @ HopSaint. Nearly black in color with a khaki head. A lot of sugary dark fruits going on here. Fruit cake, chocolate sauce, and dates dominate. Theres a big time caramel and molasses note too. The flavor has some chlorine, soap, and burnt sugar. Tons of chocolate sauce and licorice candies. Watery mouthfeel and flavor, but still not pleasant somehow. Tangy finish. Almost sour. This is not very nice.

On tap @ HopSaint. Clear golden beer with a white head. Much better than the regular IPA but still not great. A little bit of a grainy aspirin note and some pine. Fairly bitter but some sweet peach, orange, and malt. Flavor is kind of citric and mostly fine but theres a little bit of a boozy note to the finish that doesnt really work for me. Kind of sugary. Eh.

On tap @ HopSaint. Clear pale golden beer with a white head. Has some decent enough grapefruit and orange, but a whole lot of butter. Cracker, a touch of biscuit, and peach. The butter is just too strong here to really be any good. The flavor is dominated by it, despite having a fairly nice citrus hop profile. Maybe some peach and watermelon rind as well.
beer_name: HopSaint Get Out The Way IPA

review_blob: On tap @ HopSaint. Milky straw colored beer with a white head. Aromas of wax, honey, straw, orange zest, and grass here. Fairly strong pepper, lemon, and coriander notes as well. A bit of a papery note to the flavor. At least does have some fresh orange juice character, but the really waxy finish to it is not that pleasant.

Can @ Monkish. Thanks for sharing, Henry. A turbid, golden-orange colored beer with a soapy white head. Smells pretty citrusy and pine forward. More bitter than I would have expected. A bit of a woody character, particularly on the finish. Mild fruity sweetness of melon and dried mango. Is a little slick on the tongue. Overall, not bad though.
beer_name: Other Half / Barrier Make It Rain

review_blob: On tap @ Monkish. Clear and very pretty golden straw colored beer with a thick white head. Pretty much what I expected/hoped for on the nose here. Nice fruit/citrus components with notes of pineapple, passion fruit, grapefruit, and orange. Theres some bitterness of pine and citrus rind going on as well. Some grass, a bit of white pepper, and maybe chalk on the finish. Pretty nice.

On tap @ Monkish. Dark amber colored beer with a finger of khaki foam. Pretty intense stuff. Has sort of a fumey alcohol aroma to it as it gets warm. The coriander is also stronger than I anticipated. Seems to have a bit of an anise note, too. Lots of sweet caramel, some toffee, and a bit of slightly bitter burnt sugar. Hints of dark chocolate in the background and maybe a touch of coffee. Minor banana and tangy raisin on the finish.

On tap @ Monkish. Somewhat cloudy amber colored beer with a soapy off-white head. Aroma has a nice woody quality to it along with plenty of tart lemon, raisin, leather, and dried cherry. Subtle spicy notes of oak. Mild toasted sweetness, some toffee, and vinous fruits. Just a touch of acetic acid on the finish. Pretty nice.

On tap @ Madewest. Very dark brown colored beer with a khaki head. Huge chocolate sauce aroma. Rye bread, roasted malts, and some licorice. Theres a lot of caramel, toffee, and cocoa powder here as well. A touch of smoke and coffee grounds. Theres sort of a sweet and sugary dark fruits going on here. A lot of raisin in particular. Its okay.

On tap @ Madewest. Hazed orange beer with white foam. Woah, aroma is big on onion juice and dried pineapple. Pretty dank. Sweet peach, some caramel, grass, spicy grapefruit, and tea. Fair amount of sweet malt flavor. Theres a weird woody character here, lots of onion, and some garlic. Has a good bit of tropical fruit, but it doesnt quite overcome the downsides here. 3/6/6/4/12

On tap @ Madewest. Hazed golden beer with a white head. Pretty nice orange juice and pineapple hop aromas here. A lot of juicy fruits, actually. Nice bread, toast, and biscuit malts. Maybe a little bit of catty grape, too. A touch of floral and tea hops. Light bitterness. Nice enough beer. Though the mouthfeel could be better.

On tap @ Madewest. Lightly hazed golden straw beer with a white head. Lots of apple, corn, and grass. Sort of your typical macro lager aroma. The flavor has a slight mineral and metallic note to it. Theres a lot of grainy sweetness, corn, and grass. Maybe a touch of apple juice. Kind of bland and watery overall. Maybe some chalk. Eh.

On tap @ Topa Topa. Clear amber color with a dense white head. Actually some hop character, nice. Floral, a lot of flowers, some grass, and citrus peel. Theres a good bit of bread and roasted malt. Some moderate malt flavor and sweetness, but a nice bit of citrus and floral hops. Light bitterness. Lots of orange, too. Good beer, which I dont often say about this style.

Bottle @ Topa Topa. Shared by the brewer. Thanks! Black in color with a tan head. Big time bourbon aroma. Lots of vanilla, graham cracker, and chocolate. Huge molasses, toffee, and spicy wood. Intense barrel and spirit character. Well integrated spirit. A nice vanilla, licorice, toffee, and dark chocolate flavor profile. Lots of sweetness but some bitter charred oak, chocolate, and coffee. Nice beer.
beer_name: Topa Topa Black Wing - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: On tap @ Topa Topa. Clear amber colored beer with a khaki. A lot of raisin, bread, and toffee maltiness. Some light roast and chocolate but a huge banana flavor and aroma. Some sweet dark fruit aromas and flavors. Fairly sweet and a bit syrupy. A good malty character, light spice, and plenty of fruity esters. Maybe a bit of canned pear. Not bad.

On tap @ Topa Topa. Black in color with a tan head. Really roast forward. A lot of licorice, molasses, and some coffee grounds. Theres a good bit of dark chocolate, too. A bit of sweetness to the finish. A touch of chocolate covered banana, some ash, and a bit of creme brle. Not my favorite from them, but pretty good.

On tap @ Topa Topa. Clear golden beer with a white head. A good bit of honey, biscuit, and toasted bready malt. Some nice floral, grassy, and citrus peel hop character. A little bit bitter. A touch of grass and baked apple esters. Not one of their best, particularly compared to some of the other hoppy beers.
beer_name: Topa Topa Level Line Pale Ale

review_blob: On tap @ Topa Topa. Clear golden orange beer with a white head. A touch soapy and herbal up front, but theres a lot of grapefruit, orange, and pine. Light grassy hops and a touch of vegetal/herbal notes. Theres a fair amount of green onion bitterness, some pine, and grass. Nice apricot, pineapple juice, and peach as well. Not their best, but fine.

On tap @ Topa Topa. Cloudy orange beer with a white head. Big time pineapple, mango, and peach aromas. Really nice fruit character. Dried apricot, grapefruit, and a touch of pine. Bitterness is somewhat on the light side, but its not terribly sweet either. Slight grass, dried flowers, and a good bit of citrus peel.

On tap @ Topa Topa. Clear pale golden colored beer with a white head. Really nice kiwi, orange, and pine. Pretty zesty aroma and flavor. A little on the bitter side, but some peach, apricot, and light tropical fruits. Mild garlic, some tangy tropical fruits, and a good bit of soft citrus flavors. A nice beer.
beer_name: Topa Topa Solitude Single Hop IPA - Topaz

review_blob: On tap @ Topa Topa. Black pour with a khaki head. Really roasty, some bitter coffee and roasted malt, and a bit of dark chocolate. Slight earth and spice note, particularly to the flavor. The aroma is a little bit on the bland side. Nice toast and graham cracker sweetness. Pretty decent, though probably could be better if not on the nitro.
beer_name: Topa Topa Gadabout Oatmeal Stout - Coffee

review_blob: On tap @ Topa Topa. Clear golden orange beer with a white head. Nice orange and grapefruit peel aromas. Soft pine bitterness and some pale bready malts. A nice bit of grass, a touch of onion, and some beach. Nice apricot and peach notes as well. Fairly dry and bitter, pretty nice beer.

On tap @ Ale Arsenal. Pretty much clear golden beer with a finger of white foam. Huge fruit character here. Lots of mango, peach, pineapple, and grapefruit. A little bit heavy on that pine and oniony dankness. Pretty substantial bitterness, actually. Kind of a dryer malt profile but still somehow a little on the sticky side. A little sharp on the finish.

On tap @ Ale Arsenal. Milky yellow beer with a finger of white foam. Got that dank weed and onion character. Maybe a touch of butterscotch. Great fruity character, though. Plenty of lime, grapefruit, and sweet orange. Tangy tropical fruits. Some peach too, maybe. Slight citric acidity. Some bitter herbs, wood, and weed along with the onion and citrus. Decent enough juicy sweetness, too.

On tap @ Alpha Acid. Black in color, certainly. Such a metal name, bro. Chris probably came up with this. Nutty coffee, roasted malts, and a lot of hazelnut. Kind of a vanilla sweetness, too. Fairly pronounced coffee bitterness. Very earthy, nutty, and roasty. A good bit of dark chocolate, too. Kind of had a peanut M&M; thing going on. Pretty nice.
beer_name: Alpha Acid Blacker Than the Blackest Black Times Infinity

review_blob: On tap @ Alpha Acid. Hazed golden beer with a white head. This is rather dank. A whole lot of grapefruit aroma here. Lots of orange, tangerine, grass, and some pine. Flavor is a little bit on the spicy side with a lot of pithy and sticky grapefruit. Theres some very mild peach sweetness, lots of grass, citrus rind, and a dry, bitter finish.

On tap @ Alpha Acid. Milky red grapefruit juice with a white head. Not a huge aroma here. Some bread, vanilla, popcorn, and raspberry syrup make up the bulk of the aromas and flavors. There is some lemon and seedy fruit sourness to it. Aroma has a little bit of green grape and tart apple to it, I suppose. Its not huge, though. Fairly refreshing and easy drinking, though, so even though its not huge on the fruit or anything its a nice enough beer.

On tap @ Alpha Acid. Black in color with a thin ring of khaki foam. Pretty much what the kids are into these days. Bold vanilla and plenty of dark chocolate on top of a good roasted malt and semi-sweet base. Get some molasses, cocoa, and a touch of coffee. No flaws with acidity or anything, which is always nice to see. Maybe a bit sweet to drink a ton of, but definitely enjoyable.
beer_name: Alpha Acid She Puts Up With Me

review_blob: On tap @ The Trappist. Orange in color, maybe pushing amber, with some white foam. Certainly much more sweetness than I typically care for, but its not bad. I get a good tropical hop profile that works fairly well with the sweet caramel malt base. Bold bitterness of pine and citrus peel that is sort of old school, but seems okay in this beer. Overall, its fine but not my favorite.

On tap @ The Trappist. Have been wanting to try this beer for some time, so was excited to see it on the menu. Clear golden beer with a dense white head. Unfortunately, doesnt seem to be in pristine condition...shocker. Still, I think its pretty nice, though. Has some chewy bread dough, honey, biscuit, and light esters of baked apple. Subtle bitterness of grass and orange rind.

On tap @ The Good Hop. Mostly clear yellow beer with a finger of sticky, white foam. Its a bit heavy on the green onion notes, but theres plenty of pleasant grapefruit, orange, and dried pineapple notes, too. A bit of sweet caramel and bready malts. Flavor is pretty juicy and fruit forward, which is nice. Decent bite and bitterness to the finish without being overdone.

On tap @ The Good Hop. Nearly black with a thin tan head. Kind of your typical sour stout here except a little more high boost. Its got a lot of bourbon, roast, and lemon juice. Certainly some oak and a bit of tannic dark fruit and fruit skins. Kind of vinous, I suppose. More roast and coffee character on the finish than I would have expected with an acidic finish. Interesting stuff.

On tap @ The Good Hop. Hazed golden color without much in the way of carbonation or head retention. Honestly, just not a whole lot going on here. Dont really get a whole lot of peach, more just kind of a lemon juice and sour orange thing. Lactose doesnt seem to add much as there is only minor residual sweetness and the body is still lackluster. Just very acidic and not much else.
beer_name: Flat Tail Dam Wild: Peaches & Cream

review_blob: On tap @ Drakes. Turbid orange beer with a white head. Big sulfur and dank hop aroma going on here. A ton of garlic and green onion in particular. Has some of that dank pineapple and grapefruit, too. Acidic tropical fruit character is mild. Moderate bitterness, actually less bitterness than I expected. Just overall very...green and dank. Not really my favorite in the series.

On cask @ Drakes. Murky orange beer with a white head. Much better than the recent blood orange Hopocalypse they did recently. Typical bready, toasty base with juicy and plentiful citrus character. Nice fresh, pulpy orange character. Maybe a touch sweet. Mouthfeel is a little bit flat and slick, unfortunately, but otherwise this was pretty nice.
beer_name: Drakes 1500 Pale Ale with Blood Orange

review_blob: On tap @ Triple Rock. Clear golden beer with a finger of sticky white foam. Citrus forward beer with a bit of pine, grass, and dried flowers. Theres a touch of bread and marmalade sweetness. Mild to moderate bitterness on the finish of citrus peel and pine. Maybe a touch of grain husk, but overall pretty nice.

On tap @ Triple Rock. Hazed golden orange beer with a soapy white head. Kind of your typical Belgian style beer brewed in an American brewpub...but probably above average. Pretty good balance of fruit, spice, and just overall yeast driven character. Theres a lot of sweet caramel, canned peach, and some pear. Light grassy bitterness. Actually has a good bit of citrus to it that I wasnt expecting. Not too shabby.

Bottle @ Home. Turbid golden beer with a thin layer of white foam. Oh yeah, great pineapple, grapefruit, orange, and apricot. Maybe even a hint of watermelon. This is some dank stuff. Lots of lemongrass and tart fruits. Bright, citrusy, and tropical. A nice quality of peach cobbler and vanilla on the nose. Just enough sweetness of orange flavor, but theres a ton of grapefruit oily and zesty character to the flavor. Yep.

On tap @ The Trappist. Hazy yellow beer with a white head. Actually has some strawberry character, which I am at least moderately impressed by, given many of the other strawberry beers Ive had. At first, soft funk and sourness of many Jolly Pumpkin offerings. Theres a nice lemon, grass, and melon note. Maybe a bit heavy on the esters as it warms up, also becomes a touch vinegary. Definite apple peel bitterness on the finish. Started off with promise, but fell a bit flat.
beer_name: Jolly Pumpkin / Evil Twin / Leelanau Brewing Innovator Man

review_blob: On tap @ The Trappist. Yellow in color with white foam. Has a bit of an off aroma and flavor here thats not quite solvent, but not necessarily pleasant either. Overall, has many of the typical Jolly Pumpkin acidity and funk that I enjoy, though. Good peach, citrus, and melon notes. Slightly peppery and spicy. Drying grass and oak as well, seems a touch tannic. Fairly nice acidity though perhaps starting to border on acetic. Its fine, but not their best.
beer_name: Jolly Pumpkin / Evil Twin / Mikkeller / Leelanau Hamajang

review_blob: On tap Beer Revolution. Clear orange-amber beer with a white head. This is really quite bland. Disappointing. A little bit of butterscotch, some toffee, and toasted malt. A bit of citrus peel, some pine, wood, and floral hops. Kind of flat and lackluster in terms of the mouthfeel, too. A lot of tea. Pretty subtle in terms of the citrus and fruit components here. Unfortunate since I usually like Hangar 24 and theyve made some good hoppy beers lately.

On tap Beer Revolution. Hazy orange beer with a sticky white head. Theres a lot of dank pine, grapefruit, and peach. Maybe a touch of butterscotch, but really the citric hops shine and dominate. A little bit on the bitter side, but quite nice. Great fruity hop profile all the way through here. Pretty nice beer, actually.
beer_name: Triple Voodoo New Dawn New Day

review_blob: On tap Beer Revolution. Black in color with a tan head. A lot of roasted malt and coffee here with a touch of ash. Despite having a fuckton of garbage in this, it doesnt really taste or smell specifically like any of the things in it. Perhaps a canceling effect. Maybe a touch of bitterness and acidity to it, but mostly chocolate, coffee, and roast. Kind of lingers with some ash and burnt toast. Mild nuts and caramel. Weird.

On tap @ The Good Hop. Cola colored beer with an off-white head. The aroma is fairly heavy on roasted malts, cocoa, and dark fruits such as plum. Its mildly sweet and mildly bitter; sort of middling in all aspects. Dont get much in the way of yeast, esters, or phenols. Maybe a bit of anise and coriander, but not much. Light leathery note, some grassy hops, and a touch of citrus. Maybe a hint of acidic grain on the tongue.

On tap @ The Good Hop. Clear golden beer with a finger of white foam. Fairly grainy and wheat cracker forward. Certainly some lemon juice and acidity, but not overwhelmingly tart. Has a touch of zest of lemon and orange. Maybe some lactic/yogurty qualities present as well. Refreshing if nothing else.

On tap @ Rare Barrel. Lightly hazed golden beer with a white head. This one comes off a bit on the sweet side for my liking. Pretty hefty doses of tropical fruits, particularly passion fruit and mango, which I like. Some juicy, sweet citrus here as well. Theres a lot of nice things about it, but lacks a bit of the brightness I typically like about Cellarmaker hoppy beers. Mouthfeel is lacking a bit as well and comes off a touch bitter.

On tap @ Rare Barrel. Cloudy yellow beer with a white head. Pretty decent pineapple, mango, passion fruit and melon on the nose. Some zesty grapefruit as well. All the characteristics here are good, just surprisingly understated for a Cellarmaker beer. Flavor is quite fruit forward as well. Mild bitterness, some toasted grains, and plenty of tropical fruit and citrus hops. I found this to be pretty solid.

On tap @ Rare Barrel. Lightly hazed golden beer with a white head. Despite not being directly dry hopped, this is still decently hoppy...or seems to be anyway. Nice lemon and orange citrus notes. As it sits a bit, becomes a touch heavy on blue cheese and catty white wine. Fairly sour and acidic, certainly. Perhaps just a touch of vanilla sweetness on the back end. Interesting beer.

On tap @ Drakes Dealership. Pale straw colored beer with a sticky white head. Super fragrant and bright citrus. Big time lemon, tangerine, and white grapefruit. Rather pine forward, too. Theres some nice zesty and grassy aromas as well. The flavor is very dry and has a nice citric quality. Light bitterness to it. Plenty of orange, lemon, and grapefruit flavor, too. Nice herbal and piney notes as well. Nice and crushable. Good stuff.
beer_name: Triple Rock / Drakes 15 Minute Pale Ale
